p: Recently, a biobased compound, namely poly(ethylene brassylate-co-squaric acid), synthesized through the ethylene brassylate macrolactone ring-opening and copolymerization with squaric acid, was used for the encapsulation of thymol, a natural monoterpenoid phenol found in thyme oil, a compound with strong antiseptic properties [ 165]. The antimicrobial activity of poly(ethylene brassylate-co-squaric acid) thymol complex was investigated against eight different reference strains namely: bacterial strainsâ€” Staphylococcus aureus ATCC25923, Escherichia coli ATCC25922, Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212, Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 10031 and Salmonella typhimurium ATCC 14028, yeast strains represented by Candida albicans ATCC10231 and Candida glabrata ATCC 2001, and the fungal strain Aspergillus brasiliensis ATCC9642.
